title: Inheritance issue
author: spisarau
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
I have experience with a lot of software which used tree structure and inheritance, but a current system of inheritance is something I am still not able to understand.

## Expected Behavior

1. Folder (container) should contain all options which might be inherited by child.
2. By default child should inherit all options from parent.

## Current Behavior
1. Child contain some options to inherit which parent doesn't have ...

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
1. That's a fair point and something we can look into. Currently, you can inherit any value from a folder (even ones that don't show up.) We just hide properties that aren't supported for the currently selected protocol. It wouldn't hurt anything to just show all properties for folders.
1. You can set the default inheritance values for new connections by first clicking the `Connections` root node, then clicking the `Default Inheritance` button in the config panel.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Also, it is a bit unfair to call it a 'mess', regardless of your feelings toward the current system. It took me a few minutes to get over your wording in order to give your feedback a fair reading and assessment. Titling it 'Inheritance hard to understand' or 'Inheritance defaults dont make sense' or something similar would be fair, but 'mess' comes off as harsh.
